message.content:
cs.DB, cs.LO, cs.DS, cs.FL, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the expressiveness of XPath, a language used for querying XML documents, and characterizes the sets of paths in a tree that can be defined using various fragments of XPath. This falls under the scope of database systems (cs.DB) and logic in computer science (cs.LO). The paper also uses a methodology that involves characterizing when two nodes cannot be distinguished by an expression, which is related to data structures (cs.DS) and formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL). Finally, the paper's focus on language semantics and characterizing sets of nodes suggests a connection to artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
